summary: An ordinance relating to and providing for the improvement of East Cherry Street in the City of Seattle from the east line of Walla Walla Addition to 32nd Avenue by grading the same 50 feet wide, being 25 feet on both sides of the center line of said street, all in accordance with Resolution No. 675 and providing the payment therefor by the mode of 'Payment by Bond' as provided by an act of the Legislature of the State of Washington entitled "An act authorizing the issuance and sale of bonds by cities, to pay for local improvements, providing for the payment thereof, and declaring an emergency", approved March 14, 1899, and Ordinance No. 5693 of said city, approved December 6, 1899."
